title: Advanced Course on Developing Computational Thinking through ICT Integration

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental ICT proficiency and practical experience in social fields
context.additional_context: Aiming to enhance computational thinking among social sector practitioners in smartphone-limited environments. Applies iterative learning structures centered on formative assessment

learning_goals: Learners can analyze real-world social problems using algorithmic thinking to propose logical solutions.
Learners can perform data collection, analysis, and visualization processes with over 80% accuracy using smartphone-based tools.
Learners can apply computational thinking models (e.g., U-shaped/inverted U-shaped patterns) for nonlinear problem-solving to real-world cases.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
